statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Christian Webster scored 18 second-half points and Harvard overcame a 22-point halftime deficit in an 85-78 win over Brown on Saturday night.
article.headline: Harvard rallies back from 22 down vs. Brown
article.linkText: Harvard rallies back from 22 down vs. Brown
article.story: BOSTON -- Christian Webster scored 18 second-half points and Harvard overcame a 22-point halftime deficit in an 85-78 win over Brown on Saturday night. Trailing 53-31 at the break, the Crimson (18-4, 7-1 Ivy League) outscored the Bears 34-11 to take their first lead of the game, 65-64. Harvard made eight 3-pointers, held Brown to 11 field goals and outscored the Bears 46-13 in the second half. The Crimson, which won their school-record 15th straight home game, stretched their lead to as many as 11 points, 77-66, with 5:01 to play. Keith Wright had 22 points and 14 rebounds and Kyle Casey added 19 points on 8-of-11 shooting for Harvard, which won its 11th in 12 games. Sean McGonagill led the Bears (9-13, 2-6) with 18 points, 12 coming in the second half, and had seven assists. Garrett Leffelman added 14 points and Tucker Halpern and Adrian Williams chipped in 12 each for Brown.
